Some people believe that modernizing Celtic music may lead to cultural dilution, as the music's original storytelling and cultural significance is modified. However, others believe that keeping the music relevant and making it accessible to new audiences is important for preserving the music's cultural significance. 

There is a fine balance between preserving the authenticity of traditional Celtic music while also allowing it to evolve and be adapted to modern times. While modern artists may reinterpret and add elements to the music to make it more appealing to contemporary audiences, it is important to respect its cultural roots and significance. If done with sensitivity and care, modernizing Celtic music can help it continue to be celebrated and appreciated for its cultural significance for generations to come.
